title: order to mitigate the adverse economic consequences likely to result from
heading: In these Regulations, “Covid-19” means a disease caused by
text_raw:
5. 

In these Regulations, “Covid-19” means a disease caused by 
infection with the virus SARS-CoV-2 and specified as an infectious 
disease in accordance with Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the 
Infectious Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) or any 
variant of the disease so specified as an infectious disease in those 
Regulations.
text_norm: 5 regulation covid-19 mean disease caused infection virus sars-cov-2 specified infectious disease accordance regulation 6 schedule infectious disease regulation 1981 (s.i no 390 1981) variant disease specified infectious disease regulation

title: order to mitigate the adverse economic consequences likely to result from
heading: 7. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations
text_raw:
7. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 

2015 (S.I. No. 33 of 2015) are amended - 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [665] 3 

(a) by substituting at Schedule 1, paragraph 2 (c) “€0 in respect 
of replacement licences granted after the expiry date of the 
prior licence” for “€500 in respect of replacement licences 
granted after the expiry date of the prior licence provided 
that— 

(i) where the licence is replaced not more than 10 days 
after the date of expiry of the licence, the Authority 
shall refund €250 to the applicant, and 

(ii) where the licence is replaced more than 10 days but 
not more than 30 days after the date of expiry of the 
licence, the Authority shall refund €150 to the 
applicant” 

(b) by substituting at Schedule 1, paragraph 3 (c) “€0 in respect 
of replacement licences granted after the expiry date of the 
prior licence” for “€250 in respect of replacement licences 
granted after the expiry date of the prior licence provided 
that —where the licence is replaced not more than 10 days 
after the date of expiry of the licence, the Authority shall 
refund €100 to the applicant”.

title: order to mitigate the adverse economic consequences likely to result from
heading: 8. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015
text_raw:
8. The Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015 

(S.I. No. 33 of 2015) are amended – 

(a) by substituting at Schedule 1, paragraph 2 (c) “€150 in 
respect of replacement licences granted after the expiry 
date of the prior licence” for “€500 in respect of 
replacement licences granted after the expiry date of the 
prior licence provided that— 

(i) where the licence is replaced not more than 10 days 
after the date of expiry of the licence, the Authority 
shall refund €250 to the applicant, and 

(ii) where the licence is replaced more than 10 days but 
not more than 30 days after the date of expiry of the 
licence, the Authority shall refund €150 to the 
applicant” 

(b) by substituting at Schedule 1, paragraph 3 (c) “€75 in 
respect of replacement licences granted after the expiry 
date of the prior licence” for “€250 in respect of 
replacement licences granted after the expiry date of the 
prior licence provided that —where the licence is replaced 
not more than 10 days after the date of expiry of the 
licence, the Authority shall refund €100 to the applicant”, 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [665] 

GIVEN under the Seal of the National Transport Authority, 

18 December 2020. 

FRED BARRY, 

Chairperson, National Transport Authority.

title: order to mitigate the adverse economic consequences likely to result from
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of the Small Public Service Vehicle (Emergency Measure 
Covid-19) (Fees) Regulations 2020 is to temporarily amend Schedule 1 of the 
Taxi Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015 (SI. No. 33 
of 2015), Fees. These amendments are made as exceptional provisions and 
emergency measures resultant from the Covid-19 pandemic, noting that public 
transport, specifically including small public service vehicles, is deemed by 
Government to be an essential service. These amendments are time bound, 
expiring on 31st December 2021. All fees will revert to Schedule 1 of the Taxi 
Regulation (Small Public Service Vehicle) Regulations 2015 (SI. No. 33 of 
2015), Fees on 1st January 2022. 

For the period 1st January 2021 to 31st December 2021, these Regulations 
waive the fees payable in respect of the renewal of a small public service 
vehicle licence completed prior to the expiry date of the prior licence. 

For the period 28th March 2020 to 12th June 2021, these Regulations waive the 
late renewal fees in respect of replacement licences granted within 12 months 
of the expiry date of the prior licence. 

For the period 13th June 2021 to 31st December 2021, these Regulations 
replace the late renewal fees in respect of replacement licences granted within 
12 months of the expiry date of the prior licence with late renewal fees of €150 
and €75. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [665]
